description: Domain Structure Organization: Global vs Epic vs Feature Level Placement

do.description: Place concepts at appropriate level based on reuse scope
content: Place concepts at global level when used across entire system or multiple epics
Example: Global: User (used across all epics), Authentication (system-wide), Configuration (affects all capabilities)
Place concepts at epic level when used across multiple features within one epic
Example: Epic: Order Processing → Order (used by Create Order, Update Order, Cancel Order features)
Place concepts at feature level when specific to one feature
Example: Feature: Payment Processing → Payment Gateway Integration (specific to this feature only)
Order by user mental model: what users encounter first and what builds on what
Organize by domain concepts (what things ARE and what you DO with them), not file structure
Lead with domain-specific concepts, put system infrastructure at the end
Group related concepts that serve the same functional goal together
Nest implementation details under the feature they serve
Name domain concepts as nouns, describe behaviors as verbs
Prefer integration: nest related capabilities under one domain rather than creating parallel domains
Focus on functional outcomes and what concepts accomplish for users, not technical mechanisms

dont.description: Don't place concepts at wrong level or organize by technical structure
content: Don't place system-wide concepts at epic or feature level
Don't place epic-scoped concepts at global or feature level
Don't place feature-specific concepts at global or epic level
Don't order by code structure or technical layers
Don't organize by file types or code organization
Don't lead with system concepts or technical infrastructure
Don't separate related concepts into different major sections
Don't create separate sections for implementation details
Don't use verbs or gerunds for concept names
Don't create parallel domains with same root noun
Don't focus on technical implementation or mechanisms
Wrong Examples:
- Epic: User Management (WRONG - User is global)
- Feature: System Configuration (WRONG - Configuration is global)
- Global: Order (WRONG - only used in Order Processing epic)
- Feature: Order (WRONG - used by multiple features in epic)
- Global: Payment Gateway Integration (WRONG - only used in one feature)
- Epic: Data Layer → Epic: Business Logic → Epic: Presentation Layer (WRONG - technical structure)
- Epic: Models → Epic: Services → Epic: Controllers (WRONG - file structure)
- Epic: Database Layer → Epic: API Services → Epic: Order Processing (WRONG - infrastructure first)
- Epic: Login → Epic: Logout → Epic: Password Reset (WRONG - should be grouped under Authentication epic)
- Epic: Ordering (WRONG - gerund), Feature: Creating Orders (WRONG - verb form)
- Epic: Order Creation → Epic: Order Update → Epic: Order Cancellation (WRONG - should be nested under Order Management epic)
